intro: Pentagonia tinajita, commonly known as the Mexican pentagonia, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pentagonal-shaped leaves, which give it its scientific name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Pentagonia tinajita is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
